subject: history
title: Civil Disobedience Movement (1930-1934)
description: Salt Satyagraha, Dandi March, mass movement for Purna Swaraj

details.route: Sabarmati Ashram ‚Üí Dandi (Gujarat coast): 385 km, 24 days
details.act: April 6 morning: Gandhi picked salt from seashore, broke Salt Law
details.why:
‚Ä¢ Salt tax affected poorest; everyone needed salt
‚Ä¢ Simple, symbolic act everyone could understand and replicate
‚Ä¢ Salt monopoly unjust (British taxed basic necessity)
details.spread: Lakhs made illegal salt across India; millions joined movement
details.exam: **MOST ASKED**: Date, distance, companions, symbolic significance

details.methods:
‚Ä¢ Salt law breaking
‚Ä¢ Boycott foreign cloth & goods
‚Ä¢ Non-payment of taxes
‚Ä¢ Boycott of British institutions
‚Ä¢ Picketing of liquor & foreign cloth shops
‚Ä¢ Forest laws violated
details.participation:
‚Ä¢ Women: Mass participation (first time at this scale)
‚Ä¢ Students, workers, peasants, middle class
‚Ä¢ Frontier Gandhi (Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan) - Khudai Khidmatgars (Red Shirts) in NWFP
details.scale: Larger than Non-Cooperation; 90,000+ arrested including Gandhi (May 5)

details.event: Satyagrahis tried to raid Dharasana Salt Works (Gujarat)
details.brutality: Police brutally beat unarmed volunteers with steel-tipped lathis
details.reporter: American journalist Webb Miller reported worldwide
details.impact: International sympathy for India; British brutality exposed

details.violence: Lathi charges, firings (Peshawar firing killed many)

details.talks: Gandhi released from jail; negotiations with Viceroy Irwin
details.terms:
‚Ä¢ CDM suspended
‚Ä¢ Political prisoners released (except violent offenders)
‚Ä¢ Salt making allowed on coast for personal use
‚Ä¢ Picketing allowed
‚Ä¢ Gandhi agreed to attend Round Table Conference
details.criticism: Critics said Gandhi got nothing substantial; called it 'sell-out'
details.defense: Gandhi argued: moral victory; British negotiated with Indian leader as equal

details.gandhi: Gandhi alone represented Congress (wearing loincloth in London)
details.failure: Conference failed; no agreement on minorities, powers
details.quote: Gandhi: 'I am here as sole representative of Indian National Congress'

details.restart: Gandhi restarted CDM (Jan 1932) after RTC failure
details.repression: Even harsher repression; Gandhi, Congress leaders arrested immediately
details.scale: Weaker than first phase; leaders in jail, people exhausted

details.award: PM Ramsay MacDonald announced Communal Award: separate electorates for Dalits (Depressed Classes)
details.gandhiFast: Gandhi (in jail) fasted unto death against separate electorates for Dalits
details.poonaPact: Poona Pact (Sep 24, 1932): Reserved seats for Dalits but in general electorate (not separate)
details.leaders: B.R. Ambedkar agreed reluctantly; Gandhi's fast broke

details.reasons:
‚Ä¢ Mass exhaustion
‚Ä¢ Severe repression
‚Ä¢ Leaders in jail
‚Ä¢ Communal tensions rising
‚Ä¢ Economic hardship
details.gandhi: Gandhi suspended mass civil disobedience (May 1933); allowed only individual Satyagraha
details.shift: Focus shifted to constructive work and council entry

assessment.achievements:
‚Ä¢ Massive participation (larger than NCM)
‚Ä¢ Women's mass involvement
‚Ä¢ British prestige damaged
‚Ä¢ Independence demand became mass sentiment
‚Ä¢ International attention
‚Ä¢ Frontier Gandhi mobilized NWFP
assessment.limitations:
‚Ä¢ Did not achieve independence
‚Ä¢ Communal Award divided nation
‚Ä¢ Withdrawn due to repression
‚Ä¢ Property confiscations hurt middle class
assessment.significance: Proved Indians determined for freedom; prepared ground for Quit India (1942)

examTips.critical: Dandi March: March 12-April 6, 1930; 385 km; 78 companions; broke salt law
examTips.dates: Gandhi-Irwin Pact: March 5, 1931; Poona Pact: Sep 24, 1932
examTips.compare: CDM vs NCM: CDM had more women, targeted specific laws, international attention
